776d77c5-e159-47de-a9c8-b0f678676279.description: The AAMFT Clinical Fellow Designation indicates a therapist has completed the rigorous training standards for independent practice of marriage & family therapy and are held to the highest ethical standards. Clinical Fellow Designees demonstrate specific education, clinical training, and supervision in systemic marriage & family therapy. AAMFT Clinical Fellow Designation is recognized by the US state licensure boards and worldwide as the standard for education and training in systemic therapy.
776d77c5-e159-47de-a9c8-b0f678676279.name: Clinical Fellow

issuer.summary: issued by American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy

entity.name: American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy

badge_template_activities.title: Master's or Doctoral degree in MFT or related mental health field with coursework in Marriage & Family Studies, Marriage & Family Therapy, Human Development, Professional Ethics and Research, plus client contact practicum.
Minimum of two years post-degree clinical work experience in marriage and family therapy.

f2b5c573-9ee5-4fb8-9e1d-fb159edda2e6.description: AAMFT Approved Supervisor Designation is the highest and most prestigious designation in the MFT field. Our Approved Supervisors fulfill stringent education and clinical training requirements to achieve this designation. Becoming an AAMFT Approved Supervisor demonstrates a strong commitment of developing one’s supervisory skills as well as helping the next generation of systemic family therapists. It is recognized globally and accepted by most US state licensing boards requiring MFT supervision.
f2b5c573-9ee5-4fb8-9e1d-fb159edda2e6.name: AAMFT Approved Supervisor

issuer.summary: issued by American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy

entity.name: American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy

badge_template_activities.title: As outlined in the Approved Supervision Designation Standards Handbook, Approved Supervisors must be current Clinical Fellows. Pre-Clinical Fellows are eligible to become Approved Supervisors only if applying under the COAMFTE doctoral track.

The educational requirement for the AAMFT Approved Supervisor Designation is a completion of an AAMFT offered 30-hour fundamentals of supervision course which includes 15 hours of didactic and 15 hours of interactional components.

Approved Supervisor candidates obtain clinical supervision training for a minimum of 18 months, providing a minimum of 180 hours of supervision to MFT trainees,and obtaining 36 hours of mentoring from AAMFT Approved Supervisor mentor. Candidates supervise at least 2 supervises during the training period.

e9ac5e2e-7291-474f-923c-1700d9051b27.description: The Certificate of Leadership program is an 18-month program designed to strengthen leadership and communications skills among MFTs. The program utilizes a mixed modality of training methods and culminates in a self-designed research and reflection project. Past participants have gone on to hold leadership positions in leading universities, public policy institutions, community health agencies, as well as the private and non-profit industries.
e9ac5e2e-7291-474f-923c-1700d9051b27.name: AAMFT Certificate of Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy

entity.name: American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete CE, self-guided research, and establish a relationship with a designated mentor in the industry. They utilize the skills they have learned during the process to execute a self-designed project intended to challenge their development by pursuing new leadership positions, applying new strategies in career advancement, or embark upon new leadership challenges. Each candidate completes a final portfolio piece summarizing their journey submitted to a review committee.
